utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow! That ripped! That ripped real nice!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How many times do I have to tell you! Ya, turn and sliiiide! Y'know, turn and slide.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You don’t turn and slide, you throw it out! I’m tired of having to get a tetanus shot every time I get dressed!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, we’re not throwing it out! I built this thing with my own hands!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, how about we, how ‘bout we sell it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right. But, you’re gonna have to tell them.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you mind if we stick you in another cabinet? They seem all right with it!

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Hey Monica, it’s Chip.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yesss!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Who’s Chip?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Shhh!

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Good runnin’ into you at the bank today, so ah, here’s my number, 555-9323. Give me a call. Later.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chip, is Chip Matthews.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The guy who took Rachel to the prom? Why is he calling you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ‘Cause I ran into him at the bank, he is still soo cute.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica, you’re so lucky! He’s like the most popular guy in school!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!! Chip? Hi! It’s Monica. ‘Kay. ‘Kay. Okay. Okay, good-bye. Oh my God, we just had the best conversation!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I was just leaving.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good! ‘Cause I’ve got a product report to read, it’s like eight pages, I hope I don’t fall asleep.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Why? Did you write it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Look at that, Chip Matthews called. I wonder what he wants?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well ah, actually...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I bet he sensed that I was ready to have sex with another guy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, umm, why don’t you give him a call?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Are you sure you wanna hear this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Chip! Hi, it’s Rachel. Rachel Green. Yeah, umm, you left me a message. Yes you did, my roommate wrote it down. Monica Geller. Ohh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, that’s right! He called to ask out Monica! That-that’s gotta be embarrassing!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: ...DUMB, DRUNKEN, BITCH!!! Thank you, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, here’s a question; where did you guys get the finest oak East of the Mississippi?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh-huh, first you tell us where you got the prettiest lace in all the land.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m reading your ad.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Looks good, uh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Stunning entertainment center. Fine, fine Italian craftsmanship.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God, you guys are selling the entertainment center?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why? I love that thing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You want it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right look, I’m changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nooo.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. What do you do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t believe you don’t know what I do for a living!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I actually don’t know...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good, so do I

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Something to do with numbers?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you! Come on. Crazy. Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What? What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my Mother.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, no-no, she was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom Lily, the one who killed herself.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you sure she’s in the cat, or have you been taking your grandma’s glycoma medicine again?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No Dr. Skeptismo! I’m sure. First of all, okay, there’s the feeling. Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my guitar case which is lined with orange felt. My Mother’s favourite fish is Orange Roughy... Cats....like....fish! Hi, Mommy. Oh, I haven’t seen this smile in 17 years!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, Phoebe’s mom has got a huge peni...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let it go!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Umm, when were you gonna tell me that you’re going out with Chip Matthews?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nooo! It’s not okay! I can’t believe you would want to after what he did to me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What, that little thing at the prom?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica! I couldn’t find him for two hours! He was having sex with Amy Welch!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, you and I went to different high schools...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, that doesn’t help me, because we went to the same high school.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off Chip’s motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band uniform they had to have specially made.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They had to have that specially made?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out with a Chip Matthews, and now he’s-he’s called me up and asked me out. And the fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you go out with him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, really?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Just, if it’s possible, could you leave him somewhere and go have sex with another guy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll try.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment center?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I don’t think any of them are gonna work out.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming, trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So Pheebs, how long is your mom gonna be with us?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I’m not sure. I mean, I guess until she y'know, gets used to the fact that there’s y'know, a new mom. Y'know, I think she’s worried that y'know, she’s gonna, she’s gonna be replaced. Well, that’s not gonna happen is it? Noo. Okay, I have to return a call in the other room.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why can’t you use the phone in here?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I’m returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I just spelled the wrong word.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebe’s mom remind anyone of a cat?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, don’t start.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come on, you-you can’t tell me you actually believe that-that there’s a woman inside that cat!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I believe it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No you don’t.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No you do--y'know what, you’re not gonna suck me into this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I do not always have to be--okay, okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Jurassic Park could happen.

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: Wow! That’s ah, that’s pretty nice!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pretty nice?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’ll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: We don’t have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it? We’ve got a canoe.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know, I, I really don’t think we need a canoe.

utterance.speaker: Tony
utterance.content: You gotta take the canoe!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, just, just take the entertainment center, and then when you get home, throw the canoe away!

utterance.speaker: Peter
utterance.content: We’re not throwing it away! I built that canoe!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good for you!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys, you’re never gonna believe what I just found tacked up on a telephone pole! Look kinda familiar?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Apparently Phoebe’s mother also goes by the name Julio.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys, there’s a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I mean, you know what that means?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do we have to tell her?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, we have to tell her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, but it’s made her so happy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Little girl misses her cat. Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat. Okay, y'know what, I have to go have dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I hate when Ross is right!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He is right, isn’t he?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y'know what, I think this might be one of the times he’s wrong.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh-no, he’s right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, Pheebs, about your mom...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How’s that going?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and purred.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s so sweet. I’m gonna get some coffee.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Huh? What’d ya say Joe? I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I just feel so, uhh.....

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m coming already!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Jeez!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hello, Chip.

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Hey, Rach! How ya doin’?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m great! I’m great. I’ve got a great job at Bloomingdale’s, have wonderful friends, and eventhough I’m not seeing anyone right now, I’ve never felt better about myself.

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: So ah, Monica ready yet?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: She’ll be out in a second. So, Chip, how’s umm, Amy Welch?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Amy Welch? Wow! I haven’t seen her since... So, Monica about ready?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I couldn’t, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It was funny ‘til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: No, you, you can’t fit in that thing. That’s not deep enough.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah? If I can’t, I’ll knock five bucks off the price off the unit.

utterance.speaker: Guy
utterance.content: All right, you have yourself a deal.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. See?! I told ya!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Here, we are.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: The what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high school. Y'know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and you’re Chip. Nevermind.

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: No, I think it’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! A lipper from Chipper.

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: So you still in touch with anyone from high school?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm. Well, there’s Rachel, and umm, I think that’s it. How bout you?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, y'know. I see Spindler a lot. Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire, J.T., Breadsly.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is that all?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Ehh, y'know after high school, you just kinda lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran into Richard Dorfman.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ohh, how is he?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Isn’t he an architect now?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Yeah, they still wear underwear.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: OH MY GOD!!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: WHAT?!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Are you all right?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What happened?!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Awww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So--You got in voluntarily?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I was tryin’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: BEND OVER?!!!

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: ...and then Zana, just let one rip!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school with, ‘cause I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I don’t even know where you work?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: You know where I work!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I do?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You still work at the multiplex?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Oh, like I’d give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I want. I can get you free posters for your room.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks, I’m set. Do you still live with your parents?

utterance.speaker: Chip
utterance.content: Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Aww, man, he took the five of spades!! Oh, no-no-no, here it is!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! What happened?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, how was your date?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, y'know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high school?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh honey, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, it’s okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I got to dump Chip Matthews.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh! That’s so great!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, they said uh, “You don’t have insurance here, so stop calling us.”

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You didn’t tell her?! Okay, fine! Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah? Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! Listen uhh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all over the place.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohh. Um-hmm. But y'know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to respect her decision. Right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No! No! Look--Hey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom. This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ross, how many parents have you lost?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, then you don’t know what it feels like when one of them comes back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if I’m wrong, who cares? Just be a friend. Okay? Be supportive.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You could.... say you’re sorry to her mom.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I think she would like that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Come here, here, come here, come here, Mrs. Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friend’s mother.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you. We both forgive you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So honey, what are you gonna do about the little girl?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to me. And you’re welcome to come back anytime.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, we’d really appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, Mom, I’ll take you home.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh! Y'know, I’ve got an extra futon.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, you don’t have to brag! We got nothing here!!
